member.name: T:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager
member.summary: A SchemaManager is responsible for compiling schemas and maintaining a cache of compiled schemas that can be used for validating instance documents.

remarks.para: To obtain a SchemaManager, use the SchemaManager property of the Processor object.
In a schema-aware Processor there is exactly one SchemaManager (in a non-schema-aware Processor there is none).

The cache of compiled schema definitions can include only one schema component (for example a type, or an element declaration) with any given name. An attempt to compile two different schemas in the same namespace will usually therefore fail.

As soon as a type definition or element declaration is used for the first time in a validation episode, it is marked as being "sealed": this prevents subsequent modifications to the component. Examples of modifications that are thereby disallowed include adding to the substitution group of an existing element declaration, adding subtypes to an existing type, or redefining components using <xs:redefine>

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.Compile(System.IO.Stream,System.Uri)
member.summary: Compile a schema supplied as a Stream. The resulting schema components are added to the cache.
member.param: A stream containing the source text of the schema. This method will consume the supplied stream. It is the caller's responsibility to close the stream after use.
The base URI of the schema document, for resolving any references to other schema documents

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.Compile(System.Uri)
member.summary: Compile a schema, retrieving the source using a URI. The resulting schema components are added to the cache.
member.remarks: The document located via the URI is parsed using the System.Xml parser.
member.param: The URI identifying the location where the schema document can be found

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.Compile(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Compile a schema, delivered using an XmlReader. The resulting schema components are added to the cache.
member.remarks: The XmlReader is responsible for parsing the document; this method builds a tree representation of the document (in an internal Saxon format) and compiles it. The XmlReader is used as supplied; it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that its settings are appropriate for parsing a schema document (for example, that entity references are expanded and whitespace is retained.)
member.param: The XmlReader (that is, the XML parser) used to supply the source schema document

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.Compile(Saxon.Api.XdmNode)
member.summary: Compile a schema document, located at an XdmNode. This may be a document node whose child is an xs:schema element, or it may be the xs:schema element itself. The resulting schema components are added to the cache.
member.param: The document node or the outermost element node of a schema document.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.NewSchemaValidator
member.summary: Create a new SchemaValidator, which may be used for validating instance documents.

remarks.para: The SchemaValidator uses the cache of schema components held by the SchemaManager. It may also add new components to this cache (for example, when the instance document references a schema using xsi:schemaLocation). It is also affected by changes to the schema cache that occur after the SchemaValidator is created.

When schema components are used for validating instance documents (or for compiling schema-aware queries and stylesheets) they are sealed to prevent subsequent modification. The modifications disallowed once a component is sealed include adding to the substitution group of an element declaration, adding subtypes derived by extension to an existing complex type, and use of <xs:redefine>

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.GetAtomicType(Saxon.Api.QName)
member.summary: Factory method to get an AtomicType object representing the atomic type with a given QName.
member.remarks: It is undefined whether two calls on this method supplying the same QName will return the same XdmAtomicType object instance.
member.param: The QName of the required type
member.returns: An AtomicType object representing this type if it is present in this schema (and is an atomic type); otherwise, null.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.XsdVersion
member.summary: The version of the W3C XML Schema Specification handled by this SchemaManager

remarks.para: The value must be "1.0" (indicating XML Schema 1.0) or "1.1" (indicating XML Schema 1.1. The default is "1.0". New constructs defined in XSD 1.1 are rejected unless this property is set to "1.1" before compiling the schema.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.Catalog
member.summary: This property provides a way to set the catalog file which will be used by the Apache catalog resolver.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.SchemaResolver
member.summary: The SchemaResolver is a user-supplied class used for resolving references to schema documents. It applies to references from one schema document to another appearing in xs:import, xs:include, and xs:redefine; to references from an instance document to a schema in xsi:schemaLocation and xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation, to xsl:import-schema in XSLT, and to the import schema declaration in XQuery.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaManager.ErrorList
member.summary: List of errors. The caller may supply an empty list before calling Compile; the processor will then populate the list with error information obtained during the schema compilation. Each error will be included as an object of type StaticError. If no error list is supplied by the caller, error information will be written to the standard error stream.

remarks.para: By supplying a custom List with a user-written add() method, it is possible to intercept error conditions as they occur.
Note that this error list is used only for errors detected during the compilation of the schema. It is not used for errors detected when using the schema to validate a source document.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator
member.summary: A SchemaValidator is an object that is used for validating instance documents against a schema. The schema consists of the collection of schema components that are available within the schema cache maintained by the SchemaManager, together with any additional schema components located during the course of validation by means of an xsl:schemaLocation or xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation attribute within the instance document.
member.remarks: If validation fails, an exception is thrown. If validation succeeds, the validated document can optionally be written to a specified destination. This will be a copy of the original document, augmented with default values for absent elements and attributes, and carrying type annotations derived from the schema processing. Saxon does not deliver the full PSVI as described in the XML schema specifications, only the subset of the PSVI properties featured in the XDM data model.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetValidityReporting(Saxon.Api.XmlDestination)
member.summary: Setup Validation Reporting feature which saves the validation errors in an XML file
member.param: destination where XML will be sent

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetInvalidityHandler(Saxon.Api.IInvalidityHandler)
member.summary: Set the InvalidityHandler to be used when validating instance documents
member.param: handler the InvalidityHandler to be used

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.AddSource(System.IO.Stream,System.Uri)
member.summary: Add an instance document to the list of documents to be validated.
member.param: Stream source of the document
Base Uri of the source document

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.AddSource(System.Uri)
member.summary: Add an instance document to the list of documents to be validated
member.param: Uri of the source document

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.AddSource(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Add an instance document to the list of documents to be validated
member.param: Source document added a a XmlReader

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.AddSource(Saxon.Api.XdmNode)
member.summary: Add an instance document to the list of documents to be validated.
member.param: supplied as a XdmNode value

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetSource(System.IO.Stream,System.Uri)
member.summary: Supply the instance document to be validated in the form of a Stream
member.param: A stream containing the XML document to be parsed and validated. This stream will be consumed by the validation process, but it will not be closed after use: that is the responsibility of the caller.
The base URI to be used for resolving any relative references, for example a reference to an xsi:schemaLocation

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetSource(System.Uri)
member.summary: Supply the instance document to be validated in the form of a Uri reference
member.param: URI of the document to be validated

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetSource(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Supply the instance document to be validated, in the form of an XmlReader.
member.remarks: The XmlReader is responsible for parsing the document; this method validates it.
member.param: The XmlReader used to read and parse the instance document being validated. This is used as supplied. For conformance, use of a plain XmlTextReader is discouraged, because it does not expand entity references. This may cause validation failures.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetSource(Saxon.Api.XdmNode)
member.summary: Supply the instance document to be validated in the form of an XdmNode

remarks.para: The supplied node must be either a document node or an element node. If an element node is supplied, then the subtree rooted at this element is validated as if it were a complete document: that is, it must not only conform to the structure required of that element, but any referential constraints (keyref, IDREF) must be satisfied within that subtree.

member.param: The document or element node at the root of the tree to be validated

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.SetDestination(Saxon.Api.XmlDestination)
member.summary: Supply the destination to hold the validated document. If no destination is supplied, the validated document is discarded.
member.remarks: The destination differs from the source in that (a) default values of missing elements and attributes are supplied, and (b) the typed values of elements and attributes are available. However, typed values can only be accessed if the result is represented using the XDM data model, that is, if the destination is supplied as an XdmDestination.
member.param: The destination to hold the validated document.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.Run
member.summary: Run the validation of the supplied source document, optionally writing the validated document to the supplied destination.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.IsLax
member.summary: The validation mode may be either strict or lax. The default is strict; this property is set to indicate that lax validation is required. With strict validation, validation fails if no element declaration can be located for the outermost element. With lax validation, the absence of an element declaration results in the content being considered valid.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.UseXsiSchemaLocation
member.summary: This property defines whether the schema processor will recognize, and attempt to dereference, any xsi:schemaLocation and xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation attributes encountered in the instance document. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SchemaValidator.ErrorList
member.summary: List of errors. The caller may supply an empty list before calling Compile; the processor will then populate the list with error information obtained during the schema compilation. Each error will be included as an object of type StaticError. If no error list is supplied by the caller, error information will be written to the standard error stream.

remarks.para: By supplying a custom List with a user-written add() method, it is possible to intercept error conditions as they occur.
Note that this error list is used only for errors detected while using the schema to validate a source document. It is not used to report errors in the schema itself.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.SchemaResolver
member.summary: The SchemaResolver is a user-supplied class used for resolving references to schema documents. It applies to references from one schema document to another appearing in xs:import, xs:include, and xs:redefine; to references from an instance document to a schema in xsi:schemaLocation and xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation, to xsl:import-schema in XSLT, and to the import schema declaration in XQuery.

member.summary: internal class that wraps a (.NET) QueryResolver to create a (Java) SchemaURIResolver

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DotNetSchemaURIResolver.#ctor(Saxon.Api.SchemaResolver)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Resolver.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DotNetSchemaURIResolver.resolve(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Resolve the specified targetNamespace, baseURI and locations.
member.param: Target namespace.

Locations.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler
member.summary: An XQueryCompiler object allows XQuery queries to be compiled.

remarks.para: To construct an XQueryCompiler, use the factory method newXQueryCompiler on the Processor object.

The XQueryCompiler holds information that represents the static context for the queries that it compiles. This information remains intact after performing a compilation. An XQueryCompiler may therefore be used repeatedly to compile multiple queries. Any changes made to the XQueryCompiler (that is, to the static context) do not affect queries that have already been compiled. An XQueryCompiler may be used concurrently in multiple threads, but it should not then be modified once initialized.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.DeclareCollation(System.Uri,System.Globalization.CompareInfo,System.Globalization.CompareOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a collation based on a given CompareInfo and CompareOptions
member.param: The collation URI to be used within the XPath expression to refer to this collation
The CompareInfo, which determines the language-specific collation rules to be used
Options to be used in performing comparisons, for example whether they are to be case-blind and/or accent-blind
If true, this collation will be used as the default collation

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.DeclareNamespace(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Declare a namespace for use by the query. This has the same status as a namespace appearing within the query prolog (though a declaration in the query prolog of the same prefix will take precedence)
member.param: The namespace prefix to be declared. Use a zero-length string to declare the default namespace (that is, the default namespace for elements and types).
The namespace URI. It is possible to specify a zero-length string to "undeclare" a namespace.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.Compile(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Compile a query supplied as a Stream.

remarks.para: The XQuery processor attempts to deduce the encoding of the query by looking for a byte-order-mark, or if none is present, by looking for the encoding declaration in the XQuery version declaration. For this to work, the stream must have the CanSeek property. If no encoding information is present, UTF-8 is assumed.

The base URI of the query is set to the value of the BaseUri property. If this has not been set, then the base URI will be undefined, which means that any use of an expression that depends on the base URI will cause an error.

example.code: XQueryExecutable q = compiler.Compile(new FileStream("input.xq", FileMode.Open, FileAccess.Read));

member.param: A stream containing the source text of the query
member.returns: An XQueryExecutable which represents the compiled query object. The XQueryExecutable may be run as many times as required, in the same or a different thread. The XQueryExecutable is not affected by any changes made to the XQueryCompiler once it has been compiled.
member.exception: Throws a StaticError if errors were detected during static analysis of the query. Details of the errors will be added as StaticError objects to the ErrorList if supplied; otherwise they will be written to the standard error stream. The exception that is returned is merely a summary indicating the status.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.Compile(System.String)
member.summary: Compile a query supplied as a String.
member.remarks: Using this method the query processor is provided with a string of Unicode characters, so no decoding is necessary. Any encoding information present in the version declaration is therefore ignored.
member.param: A string containing the source text of the query
member.returns: An XQueryExecutable which represents the compiled query object. The XQueryExecutable may be run as many times as required, in the same or a different thread. The XQueryExecutable is not affected by any changes made to the XQueryCompiler once it has been compiled.
member.exception: Throws a StaticError if errors were detected during static analysis of the query. Details of the errors will be added as StaticError objects to the ErrorList if supplied; otherwise they will be written to the standard error stream. The exception that is returned is merely a summary indicating the status.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.Processor
member.summary: Get the Processor from which this XQueryCompiler was constructed

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.ContextItemType
member.summary: The required context item type for the expression. This is used for optimizing the expression at compile time, and to check at run-time that the value supplied for the context item is the correct type.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.BaseUri
member.summary: The base URI of the query, which forms part of the static context of the query. This is used for resolving any relative URIs appearing within the query, for example in references to library modules, schema locations, or as an argument to the doc() function.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.SchemaAware
member.summary: Say that the query must be compiled to be schema-aware, even if it contains no "import schema" declarations. Normally a query is treated as schema-aware only if it contains one or more "import schema" declarations. If it is not schema-aware, then all input documents must be untyped (or xs:anyType), and validation of temporary nodes is disallowed (though validation of the final result tree is permitted). Setting the argument to true means that schema-aware code will be compiled regardless. schemaAware If true, the stylesheet will be compiled with schema-awareness enabled even if it contains no xsl:import-schema declarations. If false, the stylesheet is treated as schema-aware only if it contains one or more xsl:import-schema declarations.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.UpdatingEnabled
member.summary: This property indicates whether XQuery Update syntax is accepted. The default value is false. This property must be set to true before compiling a query that uses update syntax.

remarks.para: This propery must be set to true before any query can be compiled that uses updating syntax. This applies even if the query is not actually an updating query (for example, a copy-modify expression). XQuery Update syntax is accepted only by Saxon-SA. Non-updating queries are accepted regardless of the value of this property.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.XQueryLanguageVersion
member.summary: This property indicates which version of XQuery language syntax is accepted. The default value is "1.0". This property must be set to "3.0" before compiling a query that uses XQuery 3.0 (formerly known as XQuery 1.1) syntax.

remarks.para: Support for XQuery 3.0 is currently limited: for details see the Saxon documentation. It cannot be used together with XQuery Updates. As well as enabling XQuery 3.0 via this API call, it must also be enabled by setting version="3.0" in the query prolog.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.QueryResolver
member.summary: A user-supplied IQueryResolver used to resolve location hints appearing in an import module declaration.

remarks.para: In the absence of a user-supplied QueryResolver, an import module declaration is interpreted as follows. First, if the module URI identifies an already loaded module, that module is used and the location hints are ignored. Otherwise, each URI listed in the location hints is resolved using the XmlResolver registered with the Processor.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.ErrorList
member.summary: List of errors. The caller should supply an empty list before calling Compile; the processor will then populate the list with error information obtained during the compilation. Each error will be included as an object of type StaticError. If no error list is supplied by the caller, error information will be written to the standard error stream.
member.remarks: By supplying a custom List with a user-written add() method, it is possible to intercept error conditions as they occur.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryCompiler.Implementation
member.summary: Escape hatch to the underying Java implementation

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XQueryExecutable
member.summary: An XQueryExecutable represents the compiled form of a query. To execute the query, it must first be loaded to form an XQueryEvaluator.

remarks.para: An XQueryExecutable is immutable, and therefore thread-safe. It is simplest to load a new XQueryEvaluator each time the query is to be run. However, the XQueryEvaluator is serially reusable within a single thread.
An XQueryExecutable is created by using one of the Compile methods on the XQueryCompiler class.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryExecutable.Load
member.summary: Load the query to prepare it for execution.
member.returns: An XQueryEvaluator. The returned XQueryEvaluator can be used to set up the dynamic context for query evaluation, and to run the query.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryExecutable.IsUpdateQuery
member.summary: Ask whether this is an updating query (that is, one that returns a pending update list rather than a convensional value).

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator
member.summary: An XQueryEvaluator represents a compiled and loaded query ready for execution. The XQueryEvaluator holds details of the dynamic evaluation context for the query.

remarks.para: An XQueryEvaluator should not be used concurrently in multiple threads. It is safe, however, to reuse the object within a single thread to run the same query several times. Running the query does not change the context that has been established.
An XQueryEvaluator is always constructed by running the Load method of an XQueryExecutable.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator.SetExternalVariable(Saxon.Api.QName,Saxon.Api.XdmValue)
member.summary: Set the value of an external variable declared in the query.
member.param: The name of the external variable, expressed as a QName. If an external variable of this name has been declared in the query prolog, the given value will be assigned to the variable. If the variable has not been declared, calling this method has no effect (it is not an error).
The value to be given to the external variable. If the variable declaration defines a required type for the variable, then this value must match the required type: no conversions are applied.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator.Evaluate
member.summary: Evaluate the query, returning the result as an XdmValue (that is, a sequence of nodes and/or atomic values).
member.returns: An XdmValue representing the results of the query
member.exception: Throws a DynamicError if any run-time failure occurs while evaluating the query.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator.EvaluateSingle
member.summary: Evaluate the query, returning the result as an XdmItem (that is, a single node or atomic value).
member.returns: An XdmItem representing the result of the query, or null if the query returns an empty sequence. If the query returns a sequence of more than one item, any items after the first are ignored.
member.exception: Throws a DynamicError if any run-time failure occurs while evaluating the expression.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Evaluate the query, returning the result as an IEnumerator (that is, an enumerator over a sequence of nodes and/or atomic values).
member.returns: An enumerator over the sequence that represents the results of the query. Each object in this sequence will be an instance of XdmItem. Note that the query may be evaluated lazily, which means that a successful response from this method does not imply that the query has executed successfully: failures may be reported later while retrieving items from the iterator.
member.exception: Throws a DynamicError if any run-time failure occurs while evaluating the expression.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator.Run(Saxon.Api.XmlDestination)
member.summary: Evaluate the query, sending the result to a specified destination.
member.param: The destination for the results of the query. The class XmlDestination is an abstraction that allows a number of different kinds of destination to be specified.
member.exception: Throws a DynamicError if any run-time failure occurs while evaluating the expression.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator.RunUpdate
member.summary: Execute an updating query.
member.returns: An array containing the root nodes of documents that have been updated by the query.
member.exception: Throws a DynamicError if any run-time failure occurs while evaluating the expression, or if the expression is not an updating query.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator.CallFunction(Saxon.Api.QName,Saxon.Api.XdmValue[])
member.summary: Call a global user-defined function in the compiled query.
member.remarks: If this is called more than once (to evaluate the same function repeatedly with different arguments, or to evaluate different functions) then the sequence of evaluations uses the same values of global variables including external variables (query parameters); the effect of any changes made to query parameters between calls is undefined.
member.param: The name of the function to be called
The values of the arguments to be supplied to the function. These must be of the correct type as defined in the function signature (there is no automatic conversion to the required type).
member.exception: If no function has been defined with the given name and arity or if any of the arguments does not match its required type according to the function signature.
If a dynamic error occurs in evaluating the function.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator.ContextItem
member.summary: The context item for the query.
member.remarks: This may be either a node or an atomic value. Most commonly it will be a document node, which might be constructed using the LoadDocument method of the Processor object.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator.SchemaValidationMode
member.summary: The SchemaValidationMode to be used in this transformation, especially for documents loaded using the doc(), document(), or collection() functions.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator.InputXmlResolver
member.summary: The XmlResolver to be used at run-time to resolve and dereference URIs supplied to the doc() function.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XQueryEvaluator.TraceFunctionDestination
member.summary:
Destination for output of messages produced using <trace()>.
If no specific destination is supplied by the caller, message information will be written to the standard error stream.

remarks.para: The supplied destination is ignored if a TraceListener is in use.
Since 9.6. Changed in 9.6 to use a StandardLogger

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.DotNetModuleURIResolver
member.summary:
Internal class that wraps a (.NET) IQueryResolver to create a (Java) ModuleURIResolver
A ModuleURIResolver is used when resolving references to query modules. It takes as input a URI that identifies the module to be loaded, and a set of location hints, and returns one or more StreamSource obects containing the queries to be imported.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DotNetModuleURIResolver.#ctor(Saxon.Api.IQueryResolver)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Resolver.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DotNetModuleURIResolver.resolve(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Resolve a module URI and associated location hints.
member.param: ModuleURI. The module namespace URI of the module to be imported; or null when loading a non-library module.
BaseURI. The base URI of the module containing the "import module" declaration; null if no base URI is known
Locations. The set of URIs specified in the "at" clause of "import module", which serve as location hints for the module
member.returns: an array of StreamSource objects each identifying the contents of a module to be imported. member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler
member.summary: An XPathCompiler object allows XPath queries to be compiled. The compiler holds information that represents the static context for the expression.

remarks.para: To construct an XPathCompiler, use the factory method newXPathCompiler on the Processor object.

An XPathCompiler may be used repeatedly to compile multiple queries. Any changes made to the XPathCompiler (that is, to the static context) do not affect queries that have already been compiled. An XPathCompiler may be used concurrently in multiple threads, but it should not then be modified once initialized.

The XPathCompiler has the ability to maintain a cache of compiled expressions. This is active only if enabled by setting the Caching property. If caching is enabled, then the compiler will recognize an attempt to compile the same expression twice, and will avoid the cost of recompiling it. The cache is emptied by any method that changes the static context for subsequent expressions, for example, by setting the BaseUri property. Unless the cache is emptied, it grows indefinitely: compiled expressions are never discarded.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.DeclareCollation(System.Uri,System.Globalization.CompareInfo,System.Globalization.CompareOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a collation based on a given CompareInfo and CompareOptions
member.param: The collation URI to be used within the XPath expression to refer to this collation
The CompareInfo, which determines the language-specific collation rules to be used
Options to be used in performing comparisons, for example whether they are to be case-blind and/or accent-blind
If true, this collation will be used as the default collation

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.DeclareNamespace(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Declare a namespace for use by the XPath expression.
member.param: The namespace prefix to be declared. Use a zero-length string to declare the default namespace (that is, the default namespace for elements and types).
The namespace URI. It is possible to specify a zero-length string to "undeclare" a namespace.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.ImportSchemaNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: Import schema definitions for a specified namespace. That is, add the element and attribute declarations and type definitions contained in a given namespace to the static context for the XPath expression.

remarks.para: This method will not cause the schema to be loaded. That must be done separately, using the SchemaManager}. This method will not fail if the schema has not been loaded (but in that case the set of declarations and definitions made available to the XPath expression is empty). The schema document for the specified namespace may be loaded before or after this method is called.
This method does not bind a prefix to the namespace. That must be done separately, using the declareNamespace method.

member.param: The namespace URI whose declarations and type definitions are to be made available for use within the XPath expression.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.SetDecimalFormatProperty(Saxon.Api.QName,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a property of a selected decimal format, for use by the format-number function.
member.remarks: This method checks that the value is valid for the particular property, but it does not check that all the values for the decimal format are consistent (for example, that the decimal separator and grouping separator have different values). This consistency check is performed only when the decimal format is used.
member.param: The name of the decimal format whose property is to be set. Supply null to set a property of the default (unnamed) decimal format. This correponds to a name used in the third argument of format-number.
The name of the property to set: one of "decimal-separator", "grouping-separator", "infinity", "NaN", "minus-sign", "percent", "per-mille", "zero-digit", "digit", or "pattern-separator".
The new value for the property.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.DeclareVariable(Saxon.Api.QName)
member.summary: Declare a variable for use by the XPath expression. If the expression refers to any variables, then they must be declared here, unless the AllowUndeclaredVariables property has been set to true.
member.param: The name of the variable, as a QName

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.Compile(System.String)
member.summary: Compile an expression supplied as a String.
member.param: A string containing the source text of the XPath expression
member.returns: An XPathExecutable which represents the compiled xpath expression object. The XPathExecutable may be run as many times as required, in the same or a different thread. The XPathExecutable is not affected by any changes made to the XPathCompiler once it has been compiled.
member.exception: Throws a Saxon.Api.StaticError if there is any static error in the XPath expression. This includes both syntax errors, semantic errors such as references to undeclared functions or variables, and statically-detected type errors.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.Evaluate(System.String,Saxon.Api.XdmItem)
member.summary: Compile and execute an expression supplied as a String, with a given context item.
member.param: A string containing the source text of the XPath expression
The context item to be used for evaluation of the XPath expression. May be null, in which case the expression is evaluated without any context item.
member.returns: An XdmValue which is the result of evaluating the XPath expression.
member.exception: Throws a Saxon.Api.StaticError if there is any static error in the XPath expression. This includes both syntax errors, semantic errors such as references to undeclared functions or variables, and statically-detected type errors.
Throws a Saxon.Api.DynamicError if there is any dynamic error during evaluation of the XPath expression. This includes, for example, referring to the context item if no context item was supplied.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.EvaluateSingle(System.String,Saxon.Api.XdmItem)
member.summary: Compile and execute an expression supplied as a String, with a given context item, where the expression is expected to return a single item as its result
member.param: A string containing the source text of the XPath expression
The context item to be used for evaluation of the XPath expression. May be null, in which case the expression is evaluated without any context item.
member.returns: If the XPath expression returns a singleton, then the the XdmItem which is the result of evaluating the XPath expression. If the expression returns an empty sequence, then null. If the expression returns a sequence containing more than one item, then the first item in the result.
member.exception: Throws a Saxon.Api.StaticError if there is any static error in the XPath expression. This includes both syntax errors, semantic errors such as references to undeclared functions or variables, and statically-detected type errors.
Throws a Saxon.Api.DynamicError if there is any dynamic error during evaluation of the XPath expression. This includes, for example, referring to the context item if no context item was supplied.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.Processor
member.summary: Get the Processor from which this XPathCompiler was constructed

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.AllowUndeclaredVariables
member.summary: This property indicates whether the XPath expression may contain references to variables that have not been explicitly declared by calling DeclareVariable. The property is false by default (that is, variables must be declared).
member.remarks: If undeclared variables are permitted, then it is possible to determine after compiling the expression which variables it refers to by calling the method EnumerateExternalVariables on the XPathExecutable object.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.SchemaAware
member.summary: Say whether XPath expressions compiled using this XPathCompiler are schema-aware. They will automatically be schema-aware if the method is called. An XPath expression must be marked as schema-aware if it is to handle typed (validated) input documents.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.XPathLanguageVersion
member.summary: This property indicates which version of XPath language syntax is accepted. The default value is "1.0". This property must be set to "3.0" before compiling a query that uses XPath 3.0 (formerly known as XPath 2.1) syntax.

remarks.para: Support for XPath 3.0 is currently limited: for details see the Saxon documentation.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.ContextItemType
member.summary: The required context item type for the expression. This is used for optimizing the expression at compile time, and to check at run-time that the value supplied for the context item is the correct type.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.BaseUri
member.summary: The base URI of the expression, which forms part of the static context of the expression. This is used for resolving any relative URIs appearing within the expression, for example in references to library modules, schema locations, or as an argument to the doc() function.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.BackwardsCompatible
member.summary: XPath 1.0 Backwards Compatibility Mode. If true, backwards compatibility mode is set. In backwards compatibility mode, more implicit type conversions are allowed in XPath expressions, for example it is possible to compare a number with a string. The default is false (backwards compatibility mode is off).

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XPathCompiler.Caching
member.summary: XPath 1.0 Backwards Compatibility Mode. If true, backwards compatibility mode is set. In backwards compatibility mode, more implicit type conversions are allowed in XPath expressions, for example it is possible to compare a number with a string. The default is false (backwards compatibility mode is off).

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XPathExecutable
member.summary: An XPathExecutable represents the compiled form of an XPath expression. To evaluate the expression, it must first be loaded to form an XPathSelector.

remarks.para: An XPathExecutable is immutable, and therefore thread-safe. It is simplest to load a new XPathSelector each time the expression is to be evaluated. However, the XPathSelector is serially reusable within a single thread.
An XPathExecutable is created by using one of the Compile methods on the XPathCompiler class.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathExecutable.EnumerateExternalVariables
member.summary: Get a list of external variables used by the expression. This will include both variables that were explicitly declared to the XPathCompiler, and (if the AllowUndeclaredVariables option was set) variables that are referenced within the expression but not explicitly declared.
member.returns: An IEnumerator over the names of the external variables, as instances of QName.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathExecutable.GetRequiredCardinalityForVariable(Saxon.Api.QName)
member.summary: Get the required cardinality of a declared variable in the static context of the expression. The occurrence indicator, one of '?' (zero-or-one), '*' (zero-or-more), '+' (one-or-more), ' ' (a single space) (exactly one), or '' (masculine ordinal indicator, xBA) (exactly zero). The type empty-sequence() can be represented by an occurrence indicator of '' with any item type. If the variable was explicitly declared, this will be the occurrence indicator that was set when the variable was declared. If no item type was set, it will be . If the variable was implicitly declared by reference (which can happen only when the allowUndeclaredVariables option is set), the returned type will be . If no variable with the specified QName has been declared either explicitly or implicitly, the method returns 0.
member.param: the name of a declared variable
member.returns: the required cardinality.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathExecutable.Load
member.summary: Load the compiled XPath expression to prepare it for execution.
member.returns: An XPathSelector. The returned XPathSelector can be used to set up the dynamic context, and then to evaluate the expression.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XPathSelector
member.summary: An XPathSelector represents a compiled and loaded XPath expression ready for execution. The XPathSelector holds details of the dynamic evaluation context for the XPath expression.

remarks.para: An XPathSelector should not be used concurrently in multiple threads. It is safe, however, to reuse the object within a single thread to evaluate the same XPath expression several times. Evaluating the expression does not change the context that has been established.
An XPathSelector is always constructed by running the Load method of an XPathExecutable.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathSelector.SetVariable(Saxon.Api.QName,Saxon.Api.XdmValue)
member.summary: Set the value of a variable
member.param: The name of the variable. This must match the name of a variable that was declared to the XPathCompiler. No error occurs if the expression does not actually reference a variable with this name.
The value to be given to the variable.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathSelector.Evaluate
member.summary: Evaluate the expression, returning the result as an XdmValue (that is, a sequence of nodes and/or atomic values).
member.remarks: Although a singleton result may be represented as an XdmItem, there is no guarantee that this will always be the case. If you know that the expression will return at most one node or atomic value, it is best to use the EvaluateSingle method, which does guarantee that an XdmItem (or null) will be returned.
member.returns: An XdmValue representing the results of the expression.
member.exception: Throws Saxon.Api.DynamicError if the evaluation of the XPath expression fails with a dynamic error.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathSelector.EvaluateSingle
member.summary: Evaluate the XPath expression, returning the result as an XdmItem (that is, a single node or atomic value).
member.returns: An XdmItem representing the result of the expression, or null if the expression returns an empty sequence. If the expression returns a sequence of more than one item, any items after the first are ignored.
member.exception: Throws Saxon.Api.DynamicError if the evaluation of the XPath expression fails with a dynamic error.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathSelector.EffectiveBooleanValue
member.summary: Evaluate the effective boolean value of the XPath expression, returning the result as a Boolean
member.returns: A Boolean representing the result of the expression, converted to its effective boolean value as if by applying the XPath boolean() function
member.exception: Throws Saxon.Api.DynamicError if the evaluation of the XPath expression fails with a dynamic error.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XPathSelector.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Evaluate the expression, returning the result as an IEnumerator (that is, an enumerator over a sequence of nodes and/or atomic values).
member.returns: An enumerator over the sequence that represents the results of the expression. Each object in this sequence will be an instance of XdmItem. Note that the expression may be evaluated lazily, which means that a successful response from this method does not imply that the expression has executed successfully: failures may be reported later while retrieving items from the iterator.
member.exception: May throw a Saxon.Api.DynamicError if the evaluation of the XPath expression fails with a dynamic error. However, some errors will not be detected during the invocation of this method, but only when stepping through the returned SequenceEnumerator.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XPathSelector.ContextItem
member.summary: The context item for the XPath expression evaluation.
member.remarks: This may be either a node or an atomic value. Most commonly it will be a document node, which might be constructed using the Build method of the DocumentBuilder object.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XPathSelector.InputXmlResolver
member.summary: The XmlResolver to be used at run-time to resolve and dereference URIs supplied to the doc() function.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.Processor
member.summary: The Processor class serves three purposes: it allows global Saxon configuration options to be set; it acts as a factory for generating XQuery, XPath, and XSLT compilers; and it owns certain shared resources such as the Saxon NamePool and compiled schemas. This is the first object that a Saxon application should create. Once established, a Processor may be used in multiple threads.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new Processor. This Processor will have capabilities that depend on the version of the software that has been loaded, and on the features that have been licensed.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a Processor.
member.param: Set to true if the Processor is to use a licensed edition of Saxon (that is, Saxon-PE or Saxon-EE). If true, the Processor will attempt to enable the capabilities of the licensed edition of Saxon, according to the version of the software that is loaded, and will verify the license key. If false, the Processor will load a default Configuration that gives restricted capability and does not require a license, regardless of which version of the software is actually being run.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a Processor.
member.param: Set to true if the Processor is to use a licensed edition of Saxon (that is, Saxon-PE or Saxon-EE). If true, the Processor will attempt to enable the capabilities of the licensed edition of Saxon, according to the version of the software that is loaded, and will verify the license key. If false, the Processor will load a default Configuration that gives restricted capability and does not require a license, regardless of which version of the software is actually being run.
This option has no effect at this release.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Create a Processor, based on configuration information supplied in a configuration file.
member.remarks: Not fully supported in this release: for experimental use only.
member.param: A stream holding the text of the XML configuration file. Details of the file format can be found in the Saxon documentation.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.NewDocumentBuilder
member.summary: Create a new DocumentBuilder, which may be used to build XDM documents from a variety of sources.
member.returns: A new DocumentBuilder

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.NewXQueryCompiler
member.summary: Create a new XQueryCompiler, which may be used to compile XQuery queries.
member.remarks: The returned XQueryCompiler retains a live link to the Processor, and may be affected by subsequent changes to the Processor.
member.returns: A new XQueryCompiler

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.NewXsltCompiler
member.summary: Create a new XsltCompiler, which may be used to compile XSLT stylesheets.
member.remarks: The returned XsltCompiler retains a live link to the Processor, and may be affected by subsequent changes to the Processor.
member.returns: A new XsltCompiler

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.NewXPathCompiler
member.summary: Create a new XPathCompiler, which may be used to compile XPath expressions.
member.remarks: The returned XPathCompiler retains a live link to the Processor, and may be affected by subsequent changes to the Processor.
member.returns: A new XPathCompiler

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.NewSerializer
member.summary: Create a Serializer
member.returns: a new Serializer

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.NewSerializer(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Create a Serializer initialized to write to a given Writer. Closing the writer after use is the responsibility of the caller.
member.param: writer The TextWriter to which the Serializer will write
member.returns: a new Serializer

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.NewSerializer(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Create a Serializer initialized to write to a given OutputStream. Closing the output stream after use is the responsibility of the caller.
member.param: stream The OutputStream to which the Serializer will write
member.returns: a new Serializer

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.DeclareCollation(System.Uri,System.Globalization.CompareInfo,System.Globalization.CompareOptions)
member.summary: Create a collation based on a given CompareInfo and CompareOptions
member.param: The collation URI to be used within the XPath expression to refer to this collation
The CompareInfo, which determines the language-specific collation rules to be used
Options to be used in performing comparisons, for example whether they are to be case-blind and/or accent-blind

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.RegisterCollection(System.Uri,System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Register a named collection. A collection is identified by a URI (the collection URI), and its content is represented by an IEnumerable that enumerates the contents of the collection. The values delivered by this enumeration are Uri values, which can be mapped to nodes using the registered XmlResolver.
member.param: The URI used to identify the collection in a call of the XPath collection() function. The default collection is registered by supplying null as the value of this argument (this is the collection returned when the XPath collection() function is called with no arguments).
An enumerable object that represents the contents of the collection, as a sequence of document URIs. The enumerator returned by this IEnumerable object must return instances of the Uri class.

remarks.para: Collections should be stable: that is, two calls to retrieve the same collection URI should return the same sequence of document URIs. This requirement is imposed by the W3C specifications, but in the case of a user-defined collection it is not enforced by the Saxon product.
A collection may be replaced by specifying the URI of an existing collection.

Collections registered with a processor are available to all queries and stylesheets running under the control of that processor. Collections should not normally be registered while queries and transformations are in progress.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.RegisterExtensionFunction(Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionDefinition)
member.summary: Register an extension function with the Processor
member.param: An object that defines the extension function, including its name, arity, arguments types, and a reference to the class that implements the extension function call.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.WriteXdmValue(Saxon.Api.XdmValue,Saxon.Api.XmlDestination)
member.summary: Copy an XdmValue to an XmlDestination
member.remarks: This method can be used to copy any kind of XdmValue to any kind of XdmDestination. The supplied XdmValue is first converted to an XML document according to the rules of the XSLT/XQuery serialization specification (for example, if the XdmValue is a sequence of atomic values, they will be turned in a text node in which the values are converted to strings and separated by single spaces). The resulting document is then written to the supplied XmlDestination.
member.param: The value to be written
The destination to which the value should be written

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.SetProperty(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set a configuration property

remarks.para: This method provides the ability to set named properties of the configuration. The property names are set as strings, whose values can be found in the Java class net.sf.saxon.FeatureKeys. The property values are always strings. Properties whose values are other types are not available via this interface: however all properties have an effective equivalent whose value is a string. Note that on/off properties are set using the strings "true" and "false".

member.param: The property name
The property value

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Processor.GetProperty(System.String)
member.summary: Get the value of a configuration property

remarks.para: This method provides the ability to get named properties of the configuration. The property names are supplied as strings, whose values can be found in the Java class net.sf.saxon.FeatureKeys. The property values are always returned as strings. Properties whose values are other types are returned by converting the value to a string. Note that on/off properties are returned using the strings "true" and "false".

member.param: The property name
member.returns: The property value, as a string; or null if the property is unset.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.Processor.ProductTitle
member.summary: Get the full name of the Saxon product version implemented by this Processor

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.Processor.ProductVersion
member.summary: Get the Saxon product version number (for example, "9.2.0.2")

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.Processor.Edition
member.summary: Get the Saxon product edition (for example, "EE" for Enterprise Edition)

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.Processor.SchemaManager
member.summary: Gets the SchemaManager for the Processor. Returns null if the Processor is not schema-aware.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.Processor.XmlResolver
member.summary: An XmlResolver, which will be used while compiling and running queries, XPath expressions, and stylesheets, if no other XmlResolver is nominated

remarks.para: By default an XmlUrlResolver is used. This means that the responsibility for resolving and dereferencing URIs rests with the .NET platform, not with the GNU Classpath.
When Saxon invokes a user-written XmlResolver, the GetEntity method may return any of: a System.IO.Stream; a System.IO.TextReader; or a java.xml.transform.Source.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.Processor.ErrorWriter
member.summary: A TextWriter used to get and set the errors from the standard output Writer

remarks.para: By default the Console.Error is used on the .NET platform.
A user can supply their own TextWriter to redirect error messages from the standard output.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.Processor.XmlVersion
member.summary: The XML version used in this Processor (for example, this determines what characters are permitted in a name)
member.remarks: The value must be 1.0 or 1.1, as a decimal. The default version is currently 1.0, but may change in the future.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.Processor.Implementation
member.summary: The underlying Configuration object in the Saxon implementation

remarks.para: This property provides access to internal methods in the Saxon engine that are not specifically exposed in the .NET API. In general these methods should be considered to be less stable than the classes in the Saxon.Api namespace.
The internal methods follow Java naming conventions rather than .NET conventions.
Information about the returned object (and the objects it provides access to) is included in the Saxon JavaDoc docmentation, available online.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder
member.summary: The DocumentBuilder class enables XDM documents to be built from various sources. The class is always instantiated using the NewDocumentBuilder method on the Processor object.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.Build(System.Uri)
member.summary: Load an XML document, retrieving it via a URI.

remarks.para: Note that the type Uri requires an absolute URI.
The URI is dereferenced using the registered XmlResolver.
This method takes no account of any fragment part in the URI.
The role passed to the GetEntity method of the XmlResolver is "application/xml", and the required return type is System.IO.Stream.
The document located via the URI is parsed using the System.Xml parser.

Note that the Microsoft System.Xml parser does not report whether attributes are defined in the DTD as being of type ID and IDREF. This is true whether or not DTD-based validation is enabled. This means that such attributes are not accessible to the id() and idref() functions.

member.param: The URI identifying the location where the document can be found. This will also be used as the base URI of the document (regardless of the setting of the BaseUri property).
member.returns: An XdmNode. This will be the document node at the root of the tree of the resulting in-memory document.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.Build(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Load an XML document supplied as raw (lexical) XML on a Stream.

remarks.para: Before calling this method, the BaseUri property must be set to identify the base URI of this document, used for resolving any relative URIs contained within it.

Note that the Microsoft System.Xml parser does not report whether attributes are defined in the DTD as being of type ID and IDREF. This is true whether or not DTD-based validation is enabled. This means that such attributes are not accessible to the id() and idref() functions.

member.param: The Stream containing the XML source to be parsed
member.returns: An XdmNode, the document node at the root of the tree of the resulting in-memory document

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.Build(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Load an XML document supplied using a TextReader.

remarks.para: Before calling this method, the BaseUri property must be set to identify the base URI of this document, used for resolving any relative URIs contained within it.

Note that the Microsoft System.Xml parser does not report whether attributes are defined in the DTD as being of type ID and IDREF. This is true whether or not DTD-based validation is enabled. This means that such attributes are not accessible to the id() and idref() functions.

member.param: The TextReader containing the XML source to be parsed
member.returns: An XdmNode, the document node at the root of the tree of the resulting in-memory document

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.Build(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Load an XML document, delivered using an XmlReader.

remarks.para: The XmlReader is responsible for parsing the document; this method builds a tree representation of the document (in an internal Saxon format) and returns its document node. The XmlReader is not required to perform validation but it must expand any entity references. Saxon uses the properties of the XmlReader as supplied.

Use of a plain XmlTextReader is discouraged, because it does not expand entity references. This should only be used if you know in advance that the document will contain no entity references (or perhaps if your query or stylesheet is not interested in the content of text and attribute nodes). Instead, with .NET 1.1 use an XmlValidatingReader (with ValidationType set to None). The constructor for XmlValidatingReader is obsolete in .NET 2.0, but the same effect can be achieved by using the Create method of XmlReader with appropriate XmlReaderSettings
Conformance with the W3C specifications requires that the Normalization property of an XmlTextReader should be set to true. However, Saxon does not insist on this.

If the XmlReader performs schema validation, Saxon will ignore any resulting type information. Type information can only be obtained by using Saxon's own schema validator, which will be run if the SchemaValidationMode property is set to Strict or Lax

Note that the Microsoft System.Xml parser does not report whether attributes are defined in the DTD as being of type ID and IDREF. This is true whether or not DTD-based validation is enabled. This means that such attributes are not accessible to the id() and idref() functions.
Note that setting the XmlResolver property of the DocumentBuilder has no effect when this method is used; if an XmlResolver is required, it must be set on the XmlReader itself.

member.param: The XMLReader that supplies the parsed XML source
member.returns: An XdmNode, the document node at the root of the tree of the resulting in-memory document

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.Build(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Load an XML DOM document, supplied as an XmlNode, into a Saxon XdmNode.

remarks.para: The returned document will contain only the subtree rooted at the supplied node.
This method copies the DOM tree to create a Saxon tree. See the Wrap method for an alternative that creates a wrapper around the DOM tree, allowing it to be modified in situ.

member.param: The DOM Node to be copied to form a Saxon tree
member.returns: An XdmNode, the document node at the root of the tree of the resulting in-memory document

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.Wrap(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Wrap an XML DOM document, supplied as an XmlNode, as a Saxon XdmNode.

remarks.para: This method must be applied at the level of the Document Node. Unlike the Build method, the original DOM is not copied. This saves memory and time, but it also means that it is not possible to perform operations such as whitespace stripping and schema validation.

member.param: The DOM document node to be wrapped
member.returns: An XdmNode, the Saxon document node at the root of the tree of the resulting in-memory document

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.XmlResolver
member.summary: An XmlResolver, which will be used to resolve URIs of documents being loaded and of references to external entities within those documents (including any external DTD).

remarks.para: By default an XmlUrlResolver is used. This means that the responsibility for resolving and dereferencing URIs rests with the .NET platform (and not with the GNU Classpath).

When Saxon invokes a user-written XmlResolver, the GetEntity method may return any of: a System.IO.Stream; a System.IO.TextReader; or a java.xml.transform.Source. However, if the XmlResolver is called by the XML parser to resolve external entity references, then it must return an instance of System.IO.Stream.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.IsLineNumbering
member.summary: Determines whether line numbering is enabled for documents loaded using this DocumentBuilder.

remarks.para: By default, line numbering is disabled.
Line numbering is not available for all kinds of source: in particular, it is not available when loading from an existing XmlDocument.
The resulting line numbers are accessible to applications using the extension function saxon:line-number() applied to a node.
Line numbers are maintained only for element nodes; the line number returned for any other node will be that of the most recent element.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.SchemaValidationMode
member.summary: Determines whether schema validation is applied to documents loaded using this DocumentBuilder, and if so, whether it is strict or lax.

remarks.para: By default, no schema validation takes place.
This option requires the schema-aware version of the Saxon product (Saxon-SA).

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.TopLevelElementName
member.summary: The required name of the top level element in a document instance being validated against a schema.

remarks.para: If this property is set, and if schema validation is requested, then validation will fail unless the outermost element of the document has the required name.
This option requires the schema-aware version of the Saxon product (Saxon-SA).

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.DtdValidation
member.summary: Determines whether DTD validation is applied to documents loaded using this DocumentBuilder.

remarks.para: By default, no DTD validation takes place.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.WhitespacePolicy
member.summary: Determines the whitespace stripping policy applied when loading a document using this DocumentBuilder.

remarks.para: By default, whitespace text nodes appearing in element-only content are stripped, and all other whitespace text nodes are retained.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.TreeModel
member.summary: The Tree Model implementation to be used for the constructed document. By default the TinyTree is used. The main reason for using the LinkedTree alternative is if updating is required (the TinyTree is not updateable).

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.DocumentBuilder.BaseUri
member.summary: The base URI of a document loaded using this DocumentBuilder. This is used for resolving any relative URIs appearing within the document, for example in references to DTDs and external entities.
member.remarks: This information is required when the document is loaded from a source that does not provide an intrinsic URI, notably when loading from a Stream or a TextReader.

members.member:
Set a compiled query to be used for implementing document projection. The effect of using this option is that the tree constructed by the DocumentBuilder contains only those parts of the source document that are needed to answer this query. Running this query against the projected document should give the same results as against the raw document, but the projected document typically occupies significantly less memory. It is permissible to run other queries against the projected document, but unless they are carefully chosen, they will give the wrong answer, because the document being used is different from the original.
The query should be written to use the projected document as its initial context item. For example, if the query is //ITEM[COLOR='blue'), then only ITEM elements and their COLOR children will be retained in the projected document.
This facility is only available in Saxon-EE; if the facility is not available, calling this method has no effect.
query the compiled query used to control document projection @since 9.6

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.StandardLogger
member.summary: The default Logger used by Saxon on the .NET platform. All messages are written by default to System.err. The logger can be configured by setting a different output destination, and by setting a minimum threshold for the severity of messages to be output.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.StandardLogger.Threshold
member.summary: Set the minimum threshold for the severity of messages to be output. Defaults to . Messages whose severity is below this threshold will be ignored
member.param: threshold the minimum severity of messages to be output.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.TreeModel
member.summary: Enumeration identifying the different tree model implementations

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.TreeModel.TinyTree
member.summary: Saxon TinyTree. This is the default model and is suitable for most purposes.

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.TreeModel.TinyTreeCondensed
member.summary: Saxon Condensed TinyTree. This is a variant of the TinyTree that shares storage for duplicated text and attribute nodes. It gives a further saving in space occupied, at the cost of some increase in the time taken for tree construction.

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.TreeModel.LinkedTree
member.summary: Saxon LinkedTree. This tree model is primarily useful when using XQuery Update, since it is the only standard tree model to support updates.

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.TreeModel.Unspecified
member.summary: Unspecified tree model. This value is used to indicate that there is no preference for any specific tree model, which allows the choice to fall back to other interfaces.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.InvalidityGatherer.ErrorList
member.summary: List of errors. The caller may supply an empty list before calling Compile; the processor will then populate the list with error information obtained during the schema compilation. Each error will be included as an object of type StaticError. If no error list is supplied by the caller, error information will be written to the standard error stream.

remarks.para: By supplying a custom List with a user-written add() method, it is possible to intercept error conditions as they occur.
Note that this error list is used only for errors detected while using the schema to validate a source document. It is not used to report errors in the schema itself.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler
member.summary: An XsltCompiler object allows XSLT 2.0 stylesheets to be compiled. The compiler holds information that represents the static context for the compilation.

remarks.para: To construct an XsltCompiler, use the factory method NewXsltCompiler on the Processor object.

An XsltCompiler may be used repeatedly to compile multiple queries. Any changes made to the XsltCompiler (that is, to the static context) do not affect queries that have already been compiled. An XsltCompiler may be used concurrently in multiple threads, but it should not then be modified once initialized.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.DeclareCollation(System.Uri,System.Globalization.CompareInfo,System.Globalization.CompareOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a collation based on a given CompareInfo and CompareOptions
member.param: The collation URI to be used within the XPath expression to refer to this collation
The CompareInfo, which determines the language-specific collation rules to be used
Options to be used in performing comparisons, for example whether they are to be case-blind and/or accent-blind
If true, this collation will be used as the default collation

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.Compile(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Compile a stylesheet supplied as a Stream.
member.param: A stream containing the source text of the stylesheet
member.returns: An XsltExecutable which represents the compiled stylesheet object. The XsltExecutable may be loaded as many times as required, in the same or a different thread. The XsltExecutable is not affected by any changes made to the XsltCompiler once it has been compiled.

remarks.para: If the stylesheet contains any xsl:include or xsl:import declarations, then the BaseURI property must be set to allow these to be resolved.

The stylesheet is contained in the part of the input stream between its current position and the end of the stream. It is the caller's responsibility to close the input stream after use. If the compilation succeeded, then on exit the stream will be exhausted; if compilation failed, the current position of the stream on exit is undefined.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.CompilePackage(System.IO.Stream)

summary.para: The source argument identifies an XML file containing an <xsl:package> element. Any packages on which this package depends must have been made available to the XsltCompiler by importing them using .

member.param: source identifies an XML document holding the the XSLT package to be compiled
member.returns: the XsltPackage that results from the compilation. Note that this package is not automatically imported to this XsltCompiler; if the package is required for use in subsequent compilations then it must be explicitly imported.

remarks.para: @since 9.6

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.CompilePackages(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.IO.Stream})
member.summary: Compile a list of packages.
member.param: the collection of packages to be compiled, in the form of an Iterable
member.returns: the collection of compiled packages, in the form of an Iterable.

remarks.para: Since 9.6
