The value to be given to the parameter. If the parameter declaration defines a required type for the variable, then this value will be converted in the same way as arguments to function calls (for example, numeric promotion is applied).

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.Compile(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Compile a stylesheet supplied as a TextReader.
member.param: A TextReader containing the source text of the stylesheet
member.returns: An XsltExecutable which represents the compiled stylesheet object. The XsltExecutable may be loaded as many times as required, in the same or a different thread. The XsltExecutable is not affected by any changes made to the XsltCompiler once it has been compiled.

remarks.para: If the stylesheet contains any xsl:include or xsl:import declarations, then the BaseURI property must be set to allow these to be resolved.

The stylesheet is contained in the part of the input stream between its current position and the end of the stream. It is the caller's responsibility to close the TextReader after use. If the compilation succeeded, then on exit the stream will be exhausted; if compilation failed, the current position of the stream on exit is undefined.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.Compile(System.Uri)
member.summary: Compile a stylesheet, retrieving the source using a URI.
member.remarks: The document located via the URI is parsed using the System.Xml parser. This URI is used as the base URI of the stylesheet: the BaseUri property of the Compiler is ignored.
member.param: The URI identifying the location where the stylesheet document can be found
member.returns: An XsltExecutable which represents the compiled stylesheet object. The XsltExecutable may be run as many times as required, in the same or a different thread. The XsltExecutable is not affected by any changes made to the XsltCompiler once it has been compiled.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.Compile(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Compile a stylesheet, delivered using an XmlReader.
member.remarks: The XmlReader is responsible for parsing the document; this method builds a tree representation of the document (in an internal Saxon format) and compiles it. The XmlReader will be used as supplied; it is the caller's responsibility to ensure that the settings of the XmlReader are consistent with the requirements of the XSLT specification (for example, that entity references are expanded and whitespace is preserved).

If the XmlReader has a BaseUri property, then that property determines the base URI of the stylesheet module, which is used when resolving any xsl:include or xsl:import declarations. If the XmlReader has no BaseUri property, then the BaseUri property of the Compiler is used instead. An ArgumentNullException is thrown if this property has not been supplied.
member.param: The XmlReader (that is, the XML parser) used to supply the document containing the principal stylesheet module.
member.returns: An XsltExecutable which represents the compiled stylesheet object. The XsltExecutable may be run as many times as required, in the same or a different thread. The XsltExecutable is not affected by any changes made to the XsltCompiler once it has been compiled.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.Compile(Saxon.Api.XdmNode)
member.summary: Compile a stylesheet, located at an XdmNode. This may be a document node whose child is an xsl:stylesheet or xsl:transform element, or it may be the xsl:stylesheet or xsl:transform element itself.
member.param: The document node or the outermost element node of the document containing the principal stylesheet module.
member.returns: An XsltExecutable which represents the compiled stylesheet object. The XsltExecutable may be run as many times as required, in the same or a different thread. The XsltExecutable is not affected by any changes made to the XsltCompiler once it has been compiled.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.CompileAssociatedStylesheet(Saxon.Api.XdmNode)
member.summary: Locate and compile a stylesheet identified by an <?xml-stylesheet?> processing instruction within a source document.
member.param: The document node of the source document containing the xml-stylesheet processing instruction.
member.returns: An XsltExecutable which represents the compiled stylesheet object.
member.remarks: There are some limitations in the current implementation. The media type is ignored, as are the other parameters of the xml-stylesheet instruction. The href attribute must either reference an embedded stylesheet within the same document or a non-embedded external stylesheet.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.BaseUri
member.summary: The base URI of the stylesheet, which forms part of the static context of the stylesheet. This is used for resolving any relative URIs appearing within the stylesheet, for example in xsl:include and xsl:import declarations, in schema locations defined to xsl:import-schema, or as an argument to the document() or doc() function.
member.remarks: This base URI is used only if the input supplied to the Compile method does not provide its own base URI. It is therefore used on the version of the method that supplies input from a Stream. On the version that supplies input from an XmlReader, this base URI is used only if the XmlReader does not have its own base URI.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.DefaultCollationName
member.summary: The name of the default collation used by stylesheets compiled using this XsltCompiler. This must be the name of a collation that is known to the Processor.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.Processor
member.summary: The Processor from which this XsltCompiler was constructed

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.XmlResolver
member.summary: An XmlResolver, which will be used to resolve URI references while compiling a stylesheet
member.remarks: If no XmlResolver is set for the XsltCompiler, the XmlResolver is used that was set on the Processor at the time NewXsltCompiler was called.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.SchemaAware
member.summary: The SchemaAware property determines whether the stylesheet is schema-aware. By default, a stylesheet is schema-aware if it contains one or more xsl:import-schema declarations. This option allows a stylesheet to be marked as schema-aware even if it does not contain such a declaration.

remarks.para: If the stylesheet is not schema-aware, then schema-validated input documents will be rejected.
The reason for this option is that it is expensive to generate code that can handle typed input documents when they will never arise in practice.
The initial setting of this property is false, regardless of whether or not the Processor is schema-aware. Setting this property to true if the processor is not schema-aware will cause an Exception.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.AssertionsEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether or not assertions (xsl:assert instructions) have been enabled at run time.
member.remarks: By default assertions are disabled at compile time. If assertions are enabled at compile time, then by default they will also be enabled at run time; but they can be disabled at run time by specific request. At compile time, assertions can be enabled for some packages and disabled for others; at run-time, they can only be enabled or disabled globally.
member.returns: true if assertions are enabled at compile time
member.remarks: Since 9.7

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.XsltLanguageVersion
member.summary: The XsltLanguageVersion property determines whether the version of the XSLT language specification implemented by the compiler. The values 2.0 and 3.0 refer to the XSLT 2.0 and XSLT 3.0 (formerly XSLT 2.1) specifications. The value 0.0 (which is the initial default) indicates that the value is to be taken from the version attribute of the xsl:stylesheet element.

remarks.para: Values that are not numerically equal to one of the above values are rejected.
A warning is output (unless suppressed) when the XSLT language version supported by the processor is different from the value of the version attribute of the xsl:stylesheet element.
XSLT 3.0 features are supported only in Saxon-PE and Saxon-EE. Setting the value to 3.0 under Saxon-HE will cause an error if (and only if) the stylesheet actually uses XSLT 3.0 constructs.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltCompiler.ErrorList
member.summary: List of errors. The caller should supply an empty list before calling Compile; the processor will then populate the list with error information obtained during the compilation. Each error will be included as an object of type StaticError. If no error list is supplied by the caller, error information will be written to an error list allocated by the system, which can be obtained as the value of this property.
member.remarks: By supplying a custom List with a user-written add() method, it is possible to intercept error conditions as they occur.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XsltExecutable
member.summary: An XsltExecutable represents the compiled form of a stylesheet. To execute the stylesheet, it must first be loaded to form an XsltTransformer.

remarks.para: An XsltExecutable is immutable, and therefore thread-safe. It is simplest to load a new XsltEvaluator each time the stylesheet is to be run. However, the XsltEvaluator is serially reusable within a single thread.
An XsltExecutable is created by using one of the Compile methods on the XsltCompiler class.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltExecutable.Load
member.summary: Load the stylesheet to prepare it for execution.
member.returns: An XsltTransformer. The returned XsltTransformer can be used to set up the dynamic context for stylesheet evaluation, and to run the stylesheet.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltExecutable.Load30
member.summary: Load the stylesheet to prepare it for execution. This version of the load() method creates an Xslt30Transformer which offers interfaces for stylesheet invocation corresponding to those described in the XSLT 3.0 specification. It can be used with XSLT 2.0 or XSLT 3.0 stylesheets, and in both cases it offers new XSLT 3.0 functionality such as the ability to supply parameters to the initial template, or the ability to invoke stylesheet-defined functions, or the ability to return an arbitrary sequence as a result without wrapping it in a document node.
member.returns: An Xslt30Transformer. The returned Xslt30Transformer can be used to set up the dynamic context for stylesheet evaluation, and to run the stylesheet.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltExecutable.Explain(Saxon.Api.XmlDestination)

member.param: The destination for the diagnostic output

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer
member.summary: An XsltTransformer represents a compiled and loaded stylesheet ready for execution. The XsltTransformer holds details of the dynamic evaluation context for the stylesheet.

remarks.para: An XsltTransformer should not be used concurrently in multiple threads. It is safe, however, to reuse the object within a single thread to run the same stylesheet several times. Running the stylesheet does not change the context that has been established.
An XsltTransformer is always constructed by running the Load method of an XsltExecutable.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmDestination
member.summary: An XdmDestination is an XmlDestination in which an XdmNode is constructed to hold the output of a query or transformation: that is, a tree using Saxon's implementation of the XDM data model

remarks.para: No data needs to be supplied to the XdmDestination object. The query or transformation populates an XmlNode, which may then be retrieved as the value of the XmlNode property.
An XdmDestination can be reused to hold the results of a second transformation only if the reset method is first called to reset its state.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XmlDestination
member.summary: An abstract destination for the results of a query or transformation

remarks.para: Note to implementors: To implement a new kind of destination, you need to supply a method getResult which returns an implementation of the JAXP Result interface. Optionally, if the destination performs serialization, you can also implement getOutputProperties, which returns the properties used for serialization.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XmlDestination.GetReceiver(net.sf.saxon.event.PipelineConfiguration)
member.summary: Get a Result to which the XML document can be sent as a series of events. This method is intended primarily for internal use.
member.remarks: The returned value must be an implementation of the JAXP Result interface that is recognized by Saxon.
member.param: Configuration information for use by the implementation

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XmlDestination.GetOutputProperties
member.summary: Get a set of Properties representing the parameters to the serializer. The default implementation returns an empty set of properties.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XmlDestination.Close
member.summary: Close the Destination, releasing any resources that need to be released.
member.remarks: This method is called by the system on completion of a query or transformation. Some kinds of Destination may need to close an output stream, others might not need to do anything. The default implementation does nothing.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmDestination.#ctor
member.summary: Construct an XdmDestination

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmDestination.Reset
member.summary: Reset the state of the XdmDestination so that it can be used to hold the result of another query or transformation.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmDestination.GetReceiver(net.sf.saxon.event.PipelineConfiguration)
member.summary: Return a Receiver. Saxon calls this method to obtain a Receiver, to which it then sends a sequence of events representing the content of an XML document.
member.returns: The receiver to which events are to be sent
member.param: Pipe. The Saxon configuration. This is supplied so that the destination can use information from the configuration (for example, a reference to the name pool) to construct or configure the returned Receiver.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmDestination.TreeModel
member.summary: The Tree Model implementation to be used for the constructed document. By default the TinyTree is used. The main reason for using the LinkedTree alternative is if updating is required (the TinyTree is not updateable)

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmDestination.BaseUri
member.summary: This property determines the base URI of the constructed XdmNode. If the baseURI property of the XdmDestination is set before the destination is written to, then the constructed XdmNode will have this base URI. Setting this property after constructing the node has no effect.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmDestination.XdmNode
member.summary: After construction, retrieve the constructed document node

remarks.para: The value of the property will be null if no data has been written to the XdmDestination, either because the process that writes to the destination has not yet been run, or because the process produced no output.

members.member: TreeProtector is a filter that ensures that the events reaching the Builder constitute a single tree rooted at an element or document node (because anything else will crash the builder)

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.SetInputStream(System.IO.Stream,System.Uri)
member.summary: Supply the principal input document for the transformation in the form of a stream.

remarks.para: If this method is used, the InitialContextNode is ignored.
The supplied stream will be consumed by the Run() method. Closing the input stream after use is the client's responsibility.
A base URI must be supplied in all cases. It is used to resolve relative URI references appearing within the input document.
Schema validation is applied to the input document according to the value of the SchemaValidationMode property.
Whitespace stripping is applied according to the value of the xsl:strip-space and xsl:preserve-space declarations in the stylesheet.

member.param: The stream containing the source code of the principal input document to the transformation. The document node at the root of this document will be the initial context node for the transformation.
The base URI of the principal input document. This is used for example by the document() function if the document contains links to other documents in the form of relative URIs.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.GetReceiver(net.sf.saxon.event.PipelineConfiguration)
member.summary: Return a Receiver. Saxon calls this method to obtain a Receiver, to which it then sends a sequence of events representing the content of an XML document.
member.returns: The receiver to which events are to be sent
member.param: Pipe. The Saxon configuration. This is supplied so that the destination can use information from the configuration (for example, a reference to the name pool) to construct or configure the returned Receiver.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.SetParameter(Saxon.Api.QName,Saxon.Api.XdmValue)
member.summary: Set the value of a stylesheet parameter.
member.param: The name of the parameter, expressed as a QName. If a parameter of this name has been declared in the stylesheet, the given value will be assigned to the variable. If the variable has not been declared, calling this method has no effect (it is not an error).

The value to be given to the parameter. If the parameter declaration defines a required type for the variable, then this value will be converted in the same way as arguments to function calls (for example, numeric promotion is applied).

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.Close
member.summary: Close the Destination, releasing any resources that need to be released.
member.remarks: This method is called by the system on completion of a query or transformation. Some kinds of Destination may need to close an output stream, others might not need to do anything. The default implementation does nothing.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.Run(Saxon.Api.XmlDestination)
member.summary: Run the transformation, sending the result to a specified destination.
member.param: The destination for the results of the stylesheet. The class XmlDestination is an abstraction that allows a number of different kinds of destination to be specified.
member.exception: Throws a DynamicError if the transformation fails.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.InitialContextNode
member.summary: The initial context item for the stylesheet.

remarks.para: This may be either a node or an atomic value. Most commonly it will be a document node, which might be constructed using the Build method of the DocumentBuilder object.

Note that this can be inefficient if the stylesheet uses xsl:strip-space to strip whitespace, or input-type-annotations="strip" to remove type annotations, since this will result in the transformation operating on a virtual document implemented as a view or wrapper of the supplied document.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.InitialMode
member.summary: The initial mode for the stylesheet. This is either a QName, for a named mode, or null, for the unnamed (default) mode.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.InitialTemplate
member.summary: The initial template for the stylesheet. This is either a QName, for a named template, or null, if no initial template has been set.
member.exception: Setting this property to the name of a template that does not exist in the stylesheet throws a DynamicError with error code XTDE0040. Setting it to the name of a template that has template parameters throws a DynamicError with error code XTDE0060.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.BaseOutputUri
member.summary: The base output URI, which acts as the base URI for resolving the href attribute of xsl:result-document.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.SchemaValidationMode
member.summary: The SchemaValidationMode to be used in this transformation, especially for documents loaded using the doc(), document(), or collection() functions.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.InputXmlResolver
member.summary: The XmlResolver to be used at run-time to resolve and dereference URIs supplied to the doc() and document() functions.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.ResultDocumentHandler
member.summary: The IResultDocumentHandler to be used at run-time to process the output produced by any xsl:result-document instruction with an href attribute.
member.remarks: In the absence of a user-supplied result document handler, the href attribute of the xsl:result-document instruction must be a valid relative URI, which is resolved against the value of the BaseOutputUri property, and the resulting absolute URI must identify a writable resource (typically a file in filestore, using the file: URI scheme).

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.MessageListener
member.summary:
Listener for messages output using <xsl:message>.
The caller may supply a message listener before calling Run; the processor will then invoke the listener once for each message generated during the transformation. Each message will be output as an object of type XdmNode representing a document node.
If no message listener is supplied by the caller, message information will be written to the standard error stream.

remarks.para: Each message is presented as an XML document node. Calling ToString() on the message object will usually generate an acceptable representation of the message.
When the <xsl:message> instruction specifies terminate="yes", the message is first notified using this interface, and then an exception is thrown which terminates the transformation.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.TraceFunctionDestination
member.summary:
Destination for output of messages using <trace()>.
If no message listener is supplied by the caller, message information will be written to the standard error stream.

remarks.para: The supplied destination is ignored if a TraceListener is in use.
Since 9.6. Changed in 9.6 to use a StandardLogger

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XsltTransformer.Destination
member.summary: The destination for the results of the stylesheet. The class XmlDestination is an abstraction that allows a number of different kinds of destination to be specified.
member.para: Set the destination to be used for the result of the transformation.

remarks.para: The Destination can be used to chain transformations into a pipeline, by using one XsltTransformer as the destination of another

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.IResultDocumentHandler
member.summary: An IResultDocumentHandler can be nominated to handle output produced by the xsl:result-document instruction in an XSLT stylesheet.

remarks.para: This interface affects any xsl:result-document instruction executed by the stylesheet, provided that it has an href attribute.

If no IResultDocumentHandler is nominated (in the IResultDocumentHandler property of the XsltTransformer), the output of xsl:result-document is serialized, and is written to the file or other resource identified by the URI in the href attribute, resolved (if it is relative) against the URI supplied in the BaseOutputUri property of the XsltTransformer.

If an IResultDocumentHandler is nominated, however, its HandleResultDocument method will be called whenever an xsl:result-document instruction with an href attribute is evaluated, and the generated result tree will be passed to the XmlDestination returned by that method.

summary.para: Abstract superclass for user-written extension functions. An extension function may be implemented as a subclass of this class, with appropriate implementations of the defined methods.

More precisely, a subclass of ExtensionFunctionDefinition identifies a family of extension functions with the same (namespace-qualified) name but potentially having different arity (number of arguments).

remarks.para: A user-defined extension function is typically implemented using a pair of classes: a class that extends ExtensionFunctionDefinition, whose purpose is to define the properties of the extension function (in particular, its signature -- the types of its arguments and result); and a class that extends ExtensionFunctionCall, whose purpose is to perform the actual evaluation.

The ExtensionFunctionDefinition is immutable and will normally have a singleton instance for each subclass; this singleton instance is registered with the Processor to associate the name of the extension function with its definition.

The ExtensionFunctionCall has one instance for each call on the extension function appearing in the source code of a stylesheet or query; this instance is created when Saxon calls the method MakeFunctionCall provided by the ExtensionFunctionDefinition object. The instance of ExtensionFunctionCall holds information about the static context of the function call, and its Call method is called (by Saxon) to evaluate the extension function at run-time.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionDefinition.ResultType(Saxon.Api.XdmSequenceType[])
member.summary: Method returning the declared type of the return value from the function. The type of the return value may be known more precisely if the types of the arguments are known (for example, some functions return a value that is the same type as the first argument. The method is therefore called supplying the static types of the actual arguments present in the call.
member.remarks: This method must be implemented in every subclass.
member.param: The static types of the arguments present in the function call
member.returns: An XdmSequenceType representing the declared return type of the extension function

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionDefinition.MakeFunctionCall
member.summary: Factory method to create an ExtensionFunctionCall object, representing a specific function call in the XSLT or XQuery source code. Saxon will call this method once it has identified that a specific call relates to this extension function.
member.remarks: This method must be implemented in every subclass. The implementation should normally instantiate the relevant subclass of ExtensionFunctionCall, and return the new instance.
member.returns: An instance of the appropriate implementation of ExtensionFunctionCall

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionDefinition.FunctionName
member.summary: Read-only property returning the name of the extension function, as a QName.
member.remarks: A getter for this property must be implemented in every subclass.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionDefinition.MinimumNumberOfArguments
member.summary: Read-only property giving the minimum number of arguments in a call to this extension function.
member.remarks: A getter for this property must be implemented in every subclass.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionDefinition.MaximumNumberOfArguments
member.summary: Read-only property giving the maximum number of arguments in a call to this extension function.
member.remarks: A getter for this property must be implemented in every subclass.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionDefinition.ArgumentTypes
member.summary: Read-only property giving the required types of the arguments to this extension function. If the number of items in the array is less than the maximum number of arguments, then the last entry in the returned ArgumentTypes is assumed to apply to all the rest; if the returned array is empty, then all arguments are assumed to be of type item()*
member.remarks: A getter for this property must be implemented in every subclass.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionDefinition.TrustResultType
member.summary: This property may return true for a subclass if it guarantees that the returned result of the function will always be of the declared return type: setting this to true by-passes the run-time checking of the type of the value, together with code that would otherwise perform atomization, numeric type promotion, and similar conversions. If the value is set to true and the value is not of the correct type, the effect is unpredictable and probably disastrous.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is false. A getter for this property may be implemented in a subclass to return a different value.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionDefinition.DependsOnFocus
member.summary: This property must return true for a subclass if the evaluation of the function makes use of the context item, position, or size from the dynamic context. It should also return true (despite the property name) if the function makes use of parts of the static context that vary from one part of the query or stylesheet to another. Setting the property to true inhibits certain Saxon optimizations, such as extracting the call from a loop, or moving it into a global variable.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is false. A getter for this property may be implemented in a subclass to return a different value.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionDefinition.HasSideEffects
member.summary: This property should return true for a subclass if the evaluation of the function has side-effects. Saxon never guarantees the result of calling functions with side-effects, but if this property is set, then certain aggressive optimizations will be avoided, making it more likely that the function behaves as expected.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is false. A getter for this property may be implemented in a subclass to return a different value.

summary.para: An instance of this class will be created by the compiler for each function call to this extension function that is found in the source code. The class is always instantiated by calling the method MakeFunctionCall() of the corresponding ExtensionFunctionDefinition. The implementation may therefore retain information about the static context of the call. Once compiled, however, the instance object must be immutable.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionCall.SupplyStaticContext(Saxon.Api.StaticContext)
member.summary: Method called by the compiler (at compile time) to provide information about the static context of the function call. The implementation may retain this information for use at run-time, if the result of the function depends on information in the static context.
member.remarks: For efficiency, the implementation should only retain copies of the information that it actually needs. It is not a good idea to hold a reference to the static context itself, since that can result in a great deal of compile-time information being locked into memory during run-time execution.
member.param: Information about the static context in which the function is called

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionCall.CopyLocalData(Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionCall)
member.summary: A subclass must implement this method if it retains any local data at the instance level. On some occasions (for example, when XSLT or XQuery code is inlined), Saxon will make a copy of an ExtensionFunction object. It will then call this method on the old object, supplying the new object as the value of the argument, and the method must copy all local data items from the old object to the new.
member.param: The new extension function object. This will always be an instance of the same class as the existing object.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.ExtensionFunctionCall.Call(Saxon.Api.IXdmEnumerator[],Saxon.Api.DynamicContext)
member.summary: Method called at run time to evaluate the function.
member.param: The values of the arguments to the function, supplied as iterators over XPath sequence values.
The dynamic context for evaluation of the function. This provides access to the context item, position, and size, and if required to internal data maintained by the Saxon engine.
member.returns: An iterator over a sequence, representing the result of the extension function. Note that Saxon does not guarantee to read this sequence to completion, so calls on the iterator must have no side-effects. In rare circumstances (for example, when last() is used) Saxon may clone the returned iterator by calling its GetAnother() method, allowing the function results to be read more than once.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.Serializer
member.summary: A Serializer takes a tree representation of XML and turns it into lexical XML markup.
member.remarks: Note that this is serialization in the sense of the W3C XSLT and XQuery specifications. Unlike the class System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer, this object does not serialize arbitrary CLI objects.

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.Serializer.METHOD

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.Serializer.DOCTYPE_PUBLIC

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.Serializer.DOCTYPE_SYSTEM

member.summary: QName identifying the serialization parameter "version"

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SAXON_CHARACTER_REPRESENTATION
member.summary: QName identifying the serialization parameter "saxon:character-representation"

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SAXON_INDENT_SPACES
member.summary: QName identifying the serialization parameter "saxon:indent-spaces". The value is an integer (represented as a string) indicating the amount of indentation required. If specified, this parameter overrides indent="no".

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SAXON_DOUBLE_SPACE
member.summary: QName identifying the serialization parameter "saxon:double-space". The value of this parameter is given as a space-separated list of expanded QNames in Clark notation, that is "{uri}local"; each QName identifies an element that should be preceded by an extra blank line within indented output.

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SAXON_SUPPRESS_INDENTATION
member.summary: QName identifying the serialization parameter "saxon:double-space". The value of this parameter is given as a space-separated list of expanded QNames in Clark notation, that is "{uri}local"; each QName identifies an element whose content should not be indented even when indent=yes is specified.

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.Serializer.NEXT_IN_CHAIN
member.summary: QName identifying the serialization parameter "saxon:next-in-chain". This is available only with XSLT, and identifies the URI of a stylesheet that is to be used to process the results before passing them to their final destination.

member.name: F:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SAXON_REQUIRE_WELL_FORMED
member.summary: QName identifying the serialization parameter "saxon:require-well-formed". The value is the string "yes" or "no". If set to "yes", the output must be a well-formed document, or an error will be reported. ("Well-formed" here means that the document node must have exactly one element child, and no text node children other than whitespace-only text nodes).

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Serializer.#ctor
member.summary: Create a Serializer

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SetOutputProperty(Saxon.Api.QName,System.String)
member.summary: Set a serialization property
member.remarks: In the case of XSLT, properties set within the serializer override any properties set in xsl:output declarations in the stylesheet. Similarly, with XQuery, they override any properties set in the Query prolog using declare option saxon:output.
member.param: The name of the serialization property to be set
The value to be set for the serialization property. May be null to unset the property (that is, to set it back to the default value).

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SetDefaultOutputProperties(java.util.Properties)
member.summary: Set default output properties, for use when no explicit properties are set using SetProperty(). The values supplied are typically those specified in the stylesheet or query. In the case of XSLT, they are the properties associated with unamed xsl:output declarations.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SetCharacterMap(net.sf.saxon.serialize.CharacterMapIndex)
member.summary: Set a character map to be used

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SetOutputFile(System.String)
member.summary: Specify the destination of the serialized output, in the form of a file name
member.param: The name of the file to receive the serialized output
member.exception: Throws a DynamicError if it is not possible to create an output stream to write to this file, for example, if the filename is in a directory that does not exist.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SetOutputStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Specify the destination of the serialized output, in the form of a Stream
member.remarks: Saxon will not close the stream on completion; this is the caller's responsibility.
member.param: The stream to which the output will be written. This must be a stream that allows writing.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SetProcessor(Saxon.Api.Processor)
member.summary: Set the Processor associated with this Serializer. This will be called automatically if the serializer is created using one of the Processor.NewSerializer() methods.
member.param: processor the associated Processor

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.Serializer.SetOutputWriter(System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Specify the destination of the serialized output, in the form of a TextWriter
member.remarks: Note that when writing to a TextWriter, character encoding is the responsibility of the TextWriter, not the Serializer. This means that the encoding requested in the output properties is ignored; it also means that characters that cannot be represented in the target encoding will use whatever fallback representation the TextWriter defines, rather than being represented as XML character references.
member.param: The stream to which the output will be written. This must be a stream that allows writing. Saxon will not close the textWriter on completion; this is the caller's responsibility.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.DomDestination
member.summary: A DomDestination represents an XmlDocument that is constructed to hold the output of a query or transformation.
member.remarks: No data needs to be supplied to the DomDestination object. The query or transformation populates an XmlDocument, which may then be retrieved as the value of the XmlDocument property

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DomDestination.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a DomDestination
member.remarks: With this constructor, the system will create a new DOM Document to act as the destination of the query or transformation results. The document node of the new document may be retrieved via the XmlDocument property.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DomDestination.#ctor(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary: Construct a DomDestination based on an existing Document node.
member.remarks: The new data will be added as a child of the supplied node.
member.param: The document node to which new contents will be attached. To ensure that the new document is well-formed, this document node should have no existing children.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DomDestination.#ctor(System.Xml.XmlDocumentFragment)
member.summary: Construct a DomDestination based on an existing DocumentFragment node.
member.remarks: The new data will be added as a child of the supplied node.
member.param: The document fragment node to which new contents will be attached. The new contents will be added after any existing children.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DomDestination.#ctor(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Construct a DomDestination based on an existing Element node.
member.remarks: The new data will be added as a child of the supplied element node.
member.param: The element node to which new contents will be attached. The new contents will be added after any existing children.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DomDestination.GetReceiver(net.sf.saxon.event.PipelineConfiguration)
member.summary: Return a Receiver. Saxon calls this method to obtain a Receiver, to which it then sends a sequence of events representing the content of an XML document.
member.param: Pipe. The Saxon pipeline configuration. This is supplied so that the destination can use information from the PipelineConfiguration (for example, a reference to the name pool) to construct or configure the returned Receiver.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.DomDestination.GetReceiver(net.sf.saxon.Configuration)
member.summary: Gets the receiver.
member.param: Config.The Saxon configuration. This is supplied so that the destination can use information from the Configuration (for example, a reference to the name pool) to construct or configure the returned Receiver.
member.returns: The receiver.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.DomDestination.XmlDocument
member.summary: After construction, retrieve the constructed document node
member.remarks: If the zero-argument constructor was used, this will be a newly constructed document node. If the constructor supplied a document node, the same document node will be returned. If the constructor supplied a document fragment node or an element node, this method returns the OwnerDocument property of that node.

member.summary: Construct a NullDestination

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.TextWriterDestination
member.summary: A TextWriterDestination is an implementation of XmlDestination that wraps an instance of XmlWriter.

remarks.para: The name TextWriterDestination is a misnomer; originally this class would only wrap an XmlTextWriter. It will now wrap any XmlWriter.

Note that when a TextWriterDestination is used to process the output of a stylesheet or query, the output format depends only on the way the underlying XmlWriter is configured; serialization parameters present in the stylesheet or query are ignored. The XSLT disable-output-escaping option is also ignored. If serialization is to be controlled from the stylesheet or query, use a Serializer as the Destination.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.TextWriterDestination.#ctor(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Construct a TextWriterDestination
member.param: The XmlWriter that is to be notified of the events representing the XML document.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.TextWriterDestination.GetReceiver(net.sf.saxon.event.PipelineConfiguration)
member.summary: Return a Receiver. Saxon calls this method to obtain a Java Receiver, to which it then sends a sequence of events representing the content of an XML document. The method is intended primarily for internal use, and may give poor diagnostics if used incorrectly.
member.returns: The receiver.
member.param: JPipelineConfiguration. The Saxon configuration. This is supplied so that the destination can use information from the configuration (for example, a reference to the name pool) to construct or configure the returned Receiver.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.TextWriterDestination.CloseAfterUse
member.summary: The CloseAfterUse property indicates whether the underlying XmlWriter is closed (by calling its Close() method) when Saxon has finished writing to it. The default value is true, in which case Close() is called. If the property is set to false, Saxon will refrain from calling the Close() method, and merely call Flush(), which can be useful if further output is to be written to the XmlWriter by the application.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmValue
member.summary: A value in the XDM data model. A value is a sequence of zero or more items, each item being either an atomic value or a node.

remarks.para: An XdmValue is immutable.

A sequence consisting of a single item may be represented as an instance of XdmItem, which is a subtype of XdmValue. However, there is no guarantee that all single-item sequences will be instances of XdmItem: if you want to ensure this, use the Simplify property.

There are various ways of creating an XdmValue. To create an atomic value, use one of the constructors on XdmAtomicValue (which is a subtype of XdmValue). To construct an XdmNode (another subtype) by parsing an XML document, or by wrapping a DOM document, use a DocumentBuilder. To create a sequence of values, use the Append method on this class to form a list from individual items or sublists.
An dmValue is also returned as the result of evaluating a query using the XQuery and XPath interfaces.

The subtype XdmEmptySequence represents an empty sequence: an XdmValue of length zero. Again, there is no guarantee that every empty sequence will be represented as an instance of XdmEmptySequence, unless you use the Simplify property.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmValue.#ctor(System.Collections.IEnumerable)
member.summary: Create a value from a collection of items
member.param: An enumerable collection providing the items to make up the sequence. Every member of this collection must be an instance of XdmItem

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmValue.Append(Saxon.Api.XdmValue)
member.summary: Create a new XdmValue by concatenating the sequences of items in this XdmValue and another XdmValue
member.remarks: Neither of the input XdmValue objects is modified by this operation
member.param: The other XdmValue, whose items are to be appended to the items from this XdmValue

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmValue.Wrap(net.sf.saxon.om.Sequence)
member.summary: Create an XdmValue from an underlying Saxon Sequence object. This method is provided for the benefit of applications that need to mix use of the Saxon .NET API with direct use of the underlying objects and methods offered by the Java implementation.
member.param: An object representing an XDM value in the underlying Saxon implementation. If the parameter is null, the method returns null.
member.returns: An XdmValue that wraps the underlying Saxon value representation.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmValue.Unwrap
member.summary: Extract the underlying Saxon Sequence object from an XdmValue. This method is provided for the benefit of applications that need to mix use of the Saxon .NET API with direct use of the underlying objects and methods offered by the Java implementation.
member.returns: An object representing the XDM value in the underlying Saxon implementation.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmValue.GetList
member.summary: Get the sequence of items in the form of an IList
member.returns: The list of items making up this value. Each item in the list will be an object of type XdmItem

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmValue.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Get the sequence of items in the form of an IXdmEnumerator
member.returns: An enumeration over the list of items making up this value. Each item in the list will be an object of type XdmItem

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmValue.Count
member.summary: Get the number of items in the sequence
member.returns: The number of items in the sequence

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmValue.Simplify
member.summary: Simplify a value: that is, reduce it to the simplest possible form. If the sequence is empty, the result will be an instance of XdmEmptySequence. If the sequence is a single node, the result will be an instance of XdmNode; if it is a single atomic value, it will be an instance of XdmAtomicValue.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmItem
member.summary: The class XdmItem represents an item in a sequence, as defined by the XDM data model. An item is either an atomic value or a node.

remarks.para: An item is a member of a sequence, but it can also be considered as a sequence (of length one) in its own right. XdmItem is a subtype of XdmValue because every Item in the XDM data model is also a value.
It cannot be assumed that every sequence of length one will be represented by an XdmItem. It is quite possible for an XdmValue that is not an XdmItem to hold a singleton sequence.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmItem.IsAtomic
member.summary: Determine whether the item is an atomic value
member.returns: true if the item is an atomic value, false if it is a Node

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue
member.summary: The class XdmAtomicValue represents an item in an XPath 2.0 sequence that is an atomic value. The value may belong to any of the 19 primitive types defined in XML Schema, or to a type derived from these primitive types, or to the XPath 2.0 type xs:untypedAtomic
member.remarks: Note that there is no guarantee that every XdmValue comprising a single atomic value will be an instance of this class. To force this, use the Simplify property of the XdmValue.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.IsAtomic
member.summary: Determine whether the item is an atomic value
member.returns: true (the item is an atomic value)

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct an atomic value of type xs:string
member.param: The string value

member.summary: Construct an atomic value of type xs:integer
member.param: The integer value

member.summary: Construct an atomic value of type xs:decimal
member.param: The decimal value

member.summary: Construct an atomic value of type xs:float
member.param: The float value

member.summary: Construct an atomic value of type xs:double

member.summary: Construct an atomic value of type xs:boolean

member.summary: Construct an atomic value of type xs:anyURI

member.summary: Construct an atomic value of type xs:QName
member.param: The QName value

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.#ctor(System.String,Saxon.Api.QName,Saxon.Api.Processor)
member.summary: Construct an atomic value of a given built-in or user-defined type

example.para: creates an untyped atomic value containing the string "abcd"

member.param: The string representation of the value (any value that is acceptable in the lexical space, as defined by XML Schema Part 2). Whitespace normalization as defined by the target type will be applied to the value.

The QName giving the name of the target type. This must be an atomic type, and it must not be a type that is namespace-sensitive (QName, NOTATION, or types derived from these). If the type is a user-defined type then its definition must be present in the schema cache maintained by the SchemaManager.

The Processor object. This is needed for looking up user-defined types, and also because some conversions are context-sensitive, for example they depend on the implicit timezone or the choice of XML 1.0 versus XML 1.1 for validating names.
member.exception: Thrown if the type is unknown or unsuitable, or if the supplied string is not a valid lexical representation of a value of the given type.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.WrapExternalObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Create an atomic value that wraps an external object. Such values can be used in conjunction with extension functions.

remarks.para: This method should not be used to create simple atomic values representing strings, numbers, booleans, and so on. For that purpose, use the relevant constructor. Wrapped external objects are used only when calling .NET native code external to a query or stylesheet.

In releases prior to 9.2, this method also existed with the alternative spelling wrapExternalObject (lower-case "w"). This was retained for backwards compatibility, but caused problems for Visual Basic users, where it is not permitted to have two methods whose names differ only in case. Any applications using wrapExternalObject must therefore be changed to use WrapExternalObject. Apologies for the inconvenience.

member.param: The object to be wrapped.
member.returns: The wrapped object

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.GetBooleanValue
member.summary: Get the value converted to a boolean using the XPath casting rules
member.returns: the result of converting to a boolean (Note: this is not the same as the effective boolean value).

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.GetLongValue
member.summary: Get the value converted to a boolean using the XPath casting rules
member.returns: the result of converting to an integer

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.GetDoubleValue
member.summary:
Get the value converted to a double using the XPath casting rules.
If the value is a string, the XSD 1.1 rules are used, which means that the string "+INF" is recognised.
member.returns: the result of converting to a double

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.GetDecimalValue
member.summary: Get the value converted to a decimal using the XPath casting rules
member.returns: return the result of converting to a decimal

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.ToString
member.summary: Convert the atomic value to a string
member.returns: The value converted to a string, according to the rules of the XPath 2.0 cast operator

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.GetTypeName(Saxon.Api.Processor)
member.summary: Get the name of the value's XDM type
member.param: The Processor object. This is needed for access to the NamePool, which maps the internal form of type names to their external form.
member.returns: The type of the value, as a QName. This may be a built-in type or a user-defined atomic type.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.GetPrimitiveTypeName
member.summary: Get the name of the primitive type of the value
member.returns: The primitive type of the value, as a QName. This will be the name of one of the primitive types defined in XML Schema Part 2, or the XPath-defined type xs:untypedAtomic. For the purposes of this method, xs:integer is considered to be a primitive type.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicValue.Value
member.summary: Get the value as a CLI object of the nearest equivalent type.

remarks.para: The return type is as follows:
xs:string - String
xs:integer - Long
xs:decimal - Decimal
xs:double - Double
xs:float - Float
xs:boolean - Bool
xs:QName - QName
xs:anyURI - Uri
xs:untypedAtomic - String
wrapped external object - the original external object
Other types - currently String, but this may change in the future

member.returns: The value converted to the most appropriate CLI type

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmFunctionItem
member.summary: The class XdmFunctionItem represents an item in an XPath 3.0 sequence that represents a function.

remarks.para: Note that there is no guarantee that every XdmValue comprising a single function item will be an instance of this class. To force this, use the Simplify property of the XdmValue.

At present the only way of creating an instance of this class is as the result of an XPath or XQuery expression that returns a function item. Note that this feature requires XPath 3.0 or XQuery 3.0 to be enabled, which in turn requires use of Saxon-EE.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmFunctionItem.IsAtomic
member.summary: Determine whether the item is an atomic value
member.returns: false (a function item is not an atomic value)

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmFunctionItem.invoke(Saxon.Api.XdmValue[],Saxon.Api.Processor)
member.summary: Invoke the function
member.param: The arguments to the function
The Saxon processor, used to provide context information
member.returns: The result of calling the function

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmFunctionItem.FunctionName
member.summary: The name of the function, as a QName. The result will be null if the function is anonymous.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmFunctionItem.Arity
member.summary: The arity of the function, that is, the number of arguments it expects

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmNode
member.summary: The class XdmNode represents a Node in the XDM Data Model. A Node is an XdmItem, and is therefore an XdmValue in its own right, and may also participate as one item within a sequence value.

remarks.para: An XdmNode is implemented as a wrapper around an object of type net.sf.saxon.NodeInfo. Because this is a key interface within Saxon, it is exposed via this API, even though it is a Java interface that is not part of the API proper.

The XdmNode interface exposes basic properties of the node, such as its name, its string value, and its typed value. Navigation to other nodes is supported through a single method, EnumerateAxis, which allows other nodes to be retrieved by following any of the XPath axes.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.IsAtomic
member.summary: Determine whether the item is an atomic value
member.returns: false (the item is not an atomic value)

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.getUnderlyingXmlNode
member.summary: Unwraps the underlying XmlNode object from the XdmValue. If the method does not wrap a XmlNode then a null is returned
member.returns: The underlying XmlNode

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.GetAttributeValue(Saxon.Api.QName)
member.summary: Get a the string value of a named attribute of this element.
member.remarks: Returns null if this node is not an element, or if this element has no attribute with the specified name.
member.param: The name of the attribute whose value is required

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.EnumerateAxis(Saxon.Api.XdmAxis)
member.summary: Get an enumerator that supplies all the nodes on one of the XPath axes, starting with this node.
member.param: The axis to be navigated, for example XdmAxis.Child for the child AxisInfo.
member.remarks: The nodes are returned in axis order: that is, document order for a forwards axis, reverse document order for a reverse AxisInfo.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.EnumerateAxis(Saxon.Api.XdmAxis,Saxon.Api.QName)
member.summary: Get an enumerator that selects all the nodes on one of the XPath axes, provided they have a given name. The nodes selected are those of the principal node kind (elements for most axes, attributes for the attribute axis, namespace nodes for the namespace axis) whose name matches the name given in the second argument.
member.param: The axis to be navigated, for example XdmAxis.Child for the child AxisInfo.
The name of the required nodes, for example new QName("", "item") to select nodes with local name "item", in no namespace.
member.remarks: The nodes are returned in axis order: that is, document order for a forwards axis, reverse document order for a reverse AxisInfo.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.WriteTo(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Send the node (that is, the subtree rooted at this node) to an XmlWriter
member.remarks: Note that a XmlWriter can only handle a well-formed XML document. This method will therefore signal an exception if the node is a document node with no children, or with more than one element child.
member.param: The XmlWriter to which the node is to be written

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Two instances of XdmNode are equal if they represent the same node. That is, the Equals() method returns the same result as the XPath "is" operator.
member.param: The object node to be compared

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.GetHashCode
member.summary: The hashCode of a node reflects the equality relationship: if two XdmNode instances represent the same node, then they have the same hashCode

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.ToString
member.summary: Return a string representation of the node.
member.remarks: This currently returns the same as the OuterXml property. To get the string value as defined in XPath, use the StringValue property.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.NodeName
member.summary: The name of the node, as a QName. Returns null in the case of unnamed nodes.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.NodeKind
member.summary: The kind of node, as an instance of System.Xml.XmlNodeType.
member.remarks: For a namespace node in the XDM model, the value XmlNodeType.None is returned.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.LineNumber
member.summary: Get the line number of the node in a source document. For a document constructed using the document builder, this is available only if the line numbering option was set wehn the document was built (and then only for element nodes). If the line number is not available, the value -1 is returned. Line numbers will typically be as reported by a SAX parser; this means that the line number for an element node is the line number containing the closing ">" of the start tag.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.ColumnNumber
member.summary: Get the column number of the node in a source document. For a document constructed using the document builder, this is available only if the line numbering option was set wehn the document was built (and then only for element nodes). If the column number is not available, the value -1 is returned. Line numbers will typically be as reported by a SAX parser; this means that the column number for an element node is the column number containing the closing ">" of the start tag.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.TypedValue
member.summary: The typed value of the node, as an instance of XdmValue.
member.exception: A DynamicError is thrown if the node has no typed value, as will be the case for an element with element-only content.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.StringValue
member.summary: The string value of the node.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Parent
member.summary: Get the parent of this node.
member.remarks: Returns either a document node, and element node, or null in the case where this node has no parent.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Root
member.summary: Get the root of the tree containing this node.
member.remarks: Returns the root of the tree containing this node (which might be this node itself).

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.BaseUri
member.summary: The Base URI of the node.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.DocumentUri
member.summary: The Document URI of the node.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.OuterXml
member.summary: Return a serialization of this node as lexical XML

remarks.para: In the case of an element node, the result will be a well-formed XML document serialized as defined in the W3C XSLT/XQuery serialization specification, using options method="xml", indent="yes", omit-xml-declaration="yes".

In the case of a document node, the result will be a well-formed XML document provided that the document node contains exactly one element child, and no text node children. In other cases it will be a well-formed external general parsed entity.
In the case of an attribute node, the output is a string in the form name="value". The name will use the original namespace prefix.
Other nodes, such as text nodes, comments, and processing instructions, are represented as they would appear in lexical XML.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmNode.Implementation
member.summary: Escape hatch to the underlying class in the Java implementation

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmEmptySequence
member.summary: The class XdmEmptySequence represents an empty sequence in the XDM Data Model.

remarks.para: An empty sequence may also be represented by an XdmValue whose length happens to be zero. Applications should therefore not test to see whether an object is an instance of this class in order to decide whether it is empty.
In interfaces that expect an XdmItem, an empty sequence is represented by a CLI null value.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.QName
member.summary: The QName class represents an instance of xs:QName, as defined in the XPath 2.0 data model. Internally, it has three components, a namespace URI, a local name, and a prefix. The prefix is intended to be used only when converting the value back to a string.
member.remarks: Note that a QName is not itself an XdmItem in this model; however it can be wrapped in an XdmItem.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct a QName representing a name in no namespace

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.#ctor(System.String,System.String)

member.param: The namespace URI. Use either the string "" or null for names that are not in any namespace.
Either the local part of the name, or the prefix and local part in the format prefix:local

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.#ctor(System.String,Saxon.Api.XdmNode)
member.summary: Construct a QName from a lexical QName, supplying an element node whose in-scope namespaces are to be used to resolve any prefix contained in the QName.

remarks.para: This constructor checks that the components of the QName are lexically valid.
If the lexical QName has no prefix, the name is considered to be in the default namespace, as defined by xmlns="...".
If the prefix of the lexical QName is not in scope, returns null.

member.param: The lexical QName, in the form prefix:local or simply local.
The element node whose in-scope namespaces are to be used to resolve the prefix part of the lexical QName.
member.exception: If the prefix of the lexical QName is not in scope
If the lexical QName is invalid (for example, if it contains invalid characters)

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.#ctor(System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName)
member.summary: Construct a QName from an XmlQualifiedName (as defined in the System.Xml package).
member.remarks: Note that an XmlQualifiedName does not contain any prefix, so the result will always have a prefix of ""
member.param: The XmlQualifiedName

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.FromClarkName(System.String)
member.summary: Factory method to construct a QName from a string containing the expanded QName in Clark notation, that is, {uri}local
member.remarks: The prefix part of the QName will be set to an empty string.
member.param: The URI in Clark notation: {uri}local if the name is in a namespace, or simply local if not.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.FromEQName(System.String)
member.summary: Factory method to construct a QName from a string containing the expanded QName in EQName notation, that is, Q{uri}local
member.remarks: The prefix part of the QName will be set to an empty string.
member.param: The URI in EQName notation: {uri}local if the name is in a namespace. For a name in no namespace, either of the forms Q{}local or simply local are accepted.
member.returns: the QName corresponding to the supplied name in EQName notation. This will always have an empty prefix.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.Register(Saxon.Api.Processor)
member.summary: Register a QName with the Processor. This makes comparison faster when the QName is compared with others that are also registered with the Processor.
member.remarks: A given QName object can only be registered with one Processor.
member.param: The Processor in which the name is to be registered.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.IsValid(Saxon.Api.Processor)
member.summary: Validate the QName against the XML 1.0 or XML 1.1 rules for valid names.
member.param: The Processor in which the name is to be validated. This determines whether the XML 1.0 or XML 1.1 rules for forming names are used.
member.returns: true if the name is valid, false if not

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.ToString
member.summary: Convert the value to a string. The resulting string is the lexical form of the QName, using the original prefix if there was one.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.GetHashCode
member.summary: Get a hash code for the QName, to support equality matching. This supports the semantics of equality, which considers only the namespace URI and local name, and not the prefix.
member.remarks: The algorithm for allocating a hash code does not depend on registering the QName with the Processor.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Test whether two QNames are equal. This supports the semantics of equality, which considers only the namespace URI and local name, and not the prefix.
member.remarks: The result of the function does not depend on registering the QName with the Processor, but is computed more quickly if the QNames have both been registered
member.param: The value to be compared with this QName. If this value is not a QName, the result is always false. Otherwise, it is true if the namespace URI and local name both match.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.QName.ToXmlQualifiedName
member.summary: Convert the value to an XmlQualifiedName (as defined in the System.Xml package)
member.remarks: Note that this loses the prefix.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.QName.Prefix
member.summary: The prefix of the QName. This plays no role in operations such as comparison of QNames for equality, but is retained (as specified in XPath) so that a string representation can be reconstructed.
member.remarks: Returns the zero-length string in the case of a QName that has no prefix.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.QName.Uri
member.summary: The namespace URI of the QName. Returns "" (the zero-length string) if the QName is not in a namespace.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.QName.LocalName
member.summary: The local part of the QName

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.QName.ClarkName
member.summary: The expanded name, as a string using the notation devised by James Clark. If the name is in a namespace, the resulting string takes the form {uri}local. Otherwise, the value is the local part of the name.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.IXdmEnumerator
member.summary: This class represents an enumeration of the values in an XPath sequence. It implements the IEnumerator interface, and the objects returned are always instances of XdmItem. In addition to the methods defined by IEnumerator, an additional method GetAnother must be implemented: this provides a new iterator over the same sequence of items, positioned at the start of the sequence.
member.remarks: Because the underlying value can be evaluated lazily, it is possible for exceptions to occur as the sequence is being read.

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.SequenceEnumerator
member.summary: This class is an implementation of IXdmEnumerator that wraps a (Java) SequenceIterator.
member.remarks: Because the underlying value can be evaluated lazily, it is possible for exceptions to occur as the sequence is being read.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SequenceEnumerator.MoveNext
member.summary: Move to the next item in the sequence
member.returns: true if there are more items in the sequence

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SequenceEnumerator.Reset
member.summary: Reset the enumeration so that the next call of MoveNext will position the enumeration at the first item in the sequence

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.SequenceEnumerator.GetAnother
member.summary: Create another XdmEnumerator over the same sequence of values, positioned at the start of the sequence, with no change to this XdmEnumerator.
member.returns: A new XdmEnumerator over the same sequence of XDM items, positioned at the start of the sequence.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.SequenceEnumerator.Current
member.summary: Return the current item in the sequence
member.returns: An object which will always be an instance of XdmItem

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.DotNetSequenceIterator

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicType
member.summary: An instance of class XdmAtomicType represents a specific atomic type, for example xs:double, xs:integer, or xs:anyAtomicType. This may be either a built-in atomic type or a type defined in a user-written schema.
member.remarks: To get an XdmAtomicType instance representing a built-in atomic type, use one of the predefined instances of the subclass XdmBuiltInAtomicType. To get an XdmAtomicType instance representing a user-defined atomic type (defined in a schema), use the method GetAtomicType defined on the SchemaManager class.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicType.BuiltInAtomicType(Saxon.Api.QName)
member.summary: Get an XdmAtomicType object representing a built-in atomic type with a given name
member.param: The name of the required built-in atomic type
member.returns: An XdmAtomicType object representing the built-in atomic type with the supplied name. Returns null if there is no built-in atomic type with this name. It is undefined whether two requests for the same built-in type will return the same object.

member.name: P:Saxon.Api.XdmAtomicType.Name
member.summary: The name of the atomic type, or null if the type is anonymous

member.name: T:Saxon.Api.XdmSequenceType
member.summary: An instance of class XdmSequenceType represents a sequence type, that is, the combination of an item type and an occurrence indicator.

member.name: M:Saxon.Api.XdmSequenceType.#ctor(Saxon.Api.XdmItemType,System.Char)
member.summary: Create an XdmSequenceType corresponding to a given XdmItemType and occurrence indicator
member.param: The item type

The occurrence indicator, one of '?' (zero-or-one), '*' (zero-or-more), '+' (one-or-more), ' ' (a single space) (exactly one), or '' (masculine ordinal indicator, xBA) (exactly zero). The type empty-sequence() can be represented by an occurrence indicator of '' with any item type.
